alert.note: Alert for Fayette (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 10 at 3:30PM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Fayette County through 400 PM CDT... At 330 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Somerville, or 16 miles northeast of Collierville, moving east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Somerville, Warren, Macon, Oakland, Williston, Yum Yum, Moorman, Taylor Chapel, Lambert, Pattersonville, Powers, Griffen and Hickory Withe. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
